text: Not yet. I filed a ticket and it's been escalated. I'll report back.

Filter for integrations are a bit special, since they do not trigger off a regular contact property but off of the properties of timeline events of that integration.

As such, unlike regular properties, if the property itself is not present, the filter will always be false (either when known or unknown, since the property simply does not exist for this contact).
That said, this contact does have SAKARI SMS events, however, you would need a different filter for that because the SMS logged on this contact are "sent SMS" not "received SMS".

If you use the "SMS Sent - Message ID is known" the contact would enroll as you can see when comparing the filters for this contact in a list test (screenshot below) Please let me know if you have any further questions in regards to this.
The test fails because the record has no such property as SMS Received - Message ID until a message is received.
